metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8779 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
rpcbind through 0.2.4, LIBTIRPC through 1.0.1 and 1.0.2-rc through1.0.2-rc3, and NTIRPC through 1.4.3 do not consider the maximum RPC datasize during memory allocation for XDR strings, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption with nosubsequent free) via a crafted UDP packet to port 111, aka rpcbomb.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8779` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtirpc1 - 0.2.5-1.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

rpcbind - 0.2.3-0.6ubuntu0.18.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libntirpc1.6 - 1.6.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libtirpc package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.5-1.2').
rpcbind package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.2.3-0.6ubuntu0.18.04.2').
ntirpc package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.1-1').
